sysevent_email_action.message_html:
Hello ${event.parm1},

 As you may be aware, NIH employees involved in the design, conduct, oversight and management of NIH-funded clinical trials are required to complete a GCP training course at a minimum of every three years.    Your new position includes clinical trials related responsibilities and you are required to complete GCP training within 30 days of employment.

 You may register to complete one of the following NCI recommended free GCP courses online by selecting one of the links below.

  •  National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) course titled "National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network Good Clinical Practice"
  •  Collaborative Institutional Training Initiative Program (CITI)
  •  National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) GCP Learning Center
  •  NIH Good Clinical Practice for Behavioral and Social Sciences Training (00162946)

 If you experience technical issues when logging into one of these online courses, please contact the help desk associated with that training.   Please contact NCI GCP Web Admin for all other inquiries regarding this email.

Once you have completed your training, please go to Training Certificate Repository to upload your completed certificate(s).  For best results, please use "Print to PDF" when completing training to output a pdf to upload to this site or you may scan the printed certificate and save as a pdf to upload.

Note:  If you have more than one certificate (i.e. the course provides individual certificates for each section of their course), you must combine those into one pdf document prior to uploading. A pdf Adobe Portfolio is not permitted for this upload.

 
 
${mail_script:GCPRequestTrainingCCSupervisor}
